Author: Regnar#6164
Content: oh yea this would work

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: but I think the concept is actually pretty important for an atomic swap powered DEX. Like how I didn't think of it before, liquidity can be huge, but only if people are actively on it, and people who are only on it to trade won't be on it for long, or long enough to find buyers/sellers. So, add a feature that gets people to stay on it longer (for fun, company, or to find traders)

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @Evitor I dont think so at this stage. PCs are very cheap these days, probably can grab one for $100 that you can leave on 24/7. But this is a problem that needs to be solved üòÉ

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: No one turns off their phones, so maybe there is some magic jl777 and Luke can do to make the mobile app workable üòÑ

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @lukechilds What do you think about this?

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: It should run on a Raspberry Pi fine in terms of resources, however I'm not sure if `marketmaker` will compile on ARM, I haven't tried that

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: Mobile app is definitely possible but I don't think it would be a replacement for a 24/7 box, it would absolutely kill the battery if it was always running in the background and would likely never get approved on the iOS app store

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: An alternative would be to work on a fully featured API for `marketmaker` v2 which could run 24/7 on a cheap VPS and then the mobile/desktop client would connect directly to that as a thin client

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I'm sure `marketmaker` will compile on Raspberry Pi fine.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Any GUI has to just replace the marketmaker in the app and it should work.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: best is to try the command line tools to run the app on Raspberry pi instead of expecting a prebuilt.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: BarterDEX GUI should work in that way.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: But since the Raspberry Pi is still a low resources machine, using it for DEX may or may not be as optimal on Desktop machines.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: should still be fine for using short time and tests.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: mm should be the same, unless the bundled mm is a different version than the one hyper is using?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You cant run two marketmakers on the same computer. So its expected that the two apps cant run at once.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: To do that in PIZZA/BEER stress test, I had to make 9 Virtual Machines to separate them all out.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: And even then, each marketmaker had to be on a different netid... As you cant have 2 marketmakers using the same public IP on the same net id.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Dont forget it is 1 mm per wan IP also.....not just computer

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: That is something we hope is fixed in mm 2.0

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes. Unless you are using multiple NetID's then you can run more than one... Thats only a nanomsg limitation as far as I am aware. Moving away from nanomsg is probably required for MM2.0. IMO.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: I dont know if you can get away from nanomsg, seems to be ingrained ....

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There has to exist better suited network stacks that can be used, I guess james used nanomsg because its C code and he had experience with it from iguana.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Yes and it worked

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: But it is not a viable solution to the DEX

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: well if we want to scale

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: mm 2.0 will be using rust which should be much better in terms of memory handling, so i have high hopes that we can make something decent
